This paragraph seems misplaced to me. There is little, if anything, in the preceding sections that suggests that Bantoid is not a valid genetic subgroup, and then suddenly this remark comes out of left field â in a section on the structure of the volume. Would it not be more helpful to integrate Blench's point of view in section 2 on the classification of EBC, or alternatively to relegate it to a footnote? Otherwise, I think it ought to be made clear why it fits at the end of section 4, and what bearing it has on the  chapters on Bantoid â if Bantoid is not a valid genetic subgroup, does that not pose a serious problem to these three chapters?
